title: afk players- THE REAL TOXICITY
body:
alright so essentially this is what makes me upset in this game

I personally think that riot should be able to sense if there is an afk in a game, having said that they should make the losing team with the afk not lose so many points in ranked. already hard enough to climb up as it is. The amount of points is just to unforgivable in those circumstances especially with an afk player who has rage quit or something

replies.body: It is more likely statistically that the other team has an afk than your team so it will even out over time even favour you.....
Again you still lose too much lp regardless. Like 16-19 or something. To unforgivable. Especially if you do well and 2 giys have a feud and one rage quits, why do the rest of us have to suffer?

> [{quoted}](name=plumbyahole,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=pdJERlkE,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-06-19T06:20:28.437+0000)
>
> Again you still lose too much lp regardless. Like 16-19 or something. To unforgivable. Especially if you do well and 2 giys have a feud and one rage quits, why do the rest of us have to suffer?

Incorporating something like Loss Forgiven for players who disconnect or leave could potentially (and will likely) be abused. /Remake is a good step towards evening out matches who have players who are unable to connect in the first few minutes of the game, and I think any changes to the way LP distribution is affected by leavers should be limited to the first few minutes of the match.

Ultimately, players who consistently and/or maliciously leave matches will be punished by one of Riot's systems - LeaverBuster, Manual Audits, Instant Feedback, and Intentional Feeder detection.
They can sense AFK players, but to actually get anything serious you have to afk in a multitude of games.
Regardless. You still lose like 16-19 lp which is harsh dude. U lose just as much even if there are no afk's
